description: Complete reference for Mendix Studio Pro including Mendix 11 features, domain modeling, microflows, pages, security, and breaking changes. Covers all aspects of visual development in Mendix's desktop IDE.

mendix_11_features.description: Built-in optimistic locking to prevent lost updates during concurrent modifications. Adds MxObjectVersion system attribute to all entities.
mendix_11_features.impact: Safe-guards against concurrent modifications without requiring custom versioning logic
mendix_11_features.how_to_enable: Runtime tab in App Settings dialog → Enable Optimistic Locking

behavior.commit: Compares MxObjectVersion with database; throws ConcurrentModificationRuntimeException if different

mendix_11_features.error_handling: Catch ConcurrentModificationRuntimeException, retrieve fresh object, reapply changes, retry

mendix_11_features.description: Pages and snippets can capture and use return values from microflows/nanoflows by mapping to variables or attributes
mendix_11_features.impact: Enhanced microflow reusability - pages can update local values without passing objects
use_cases: Assign primitive return values to attributes or page variables
Map multiple attributes from object return values
Transform return values using expressions before assignment

mendix_11_features.description: View changes and navigate to modified documents without closing the history view. Shows both local and server commits.
mendix_11_features.impact: Easier tracking of changes and collaboration

mendix_11_features.description: Convert old Dojo widgets no longer supported by React client in batches
mendix_11_features.impact: Easier migration from Dojo to React client

mendix_11_features.description: Manually fetch changes from version control server without applying to local copy
mendix_11_features.impact: Better inspection of server-side changes before pulling

mendix_11_features.description: OQL UPDATE statements can now update associations via experimental Java API OqlStatement
Sessions expire after configured time regardless of activity
Conversational AI assistant integrated into Studio Pro that helps build domain models, workflows, pages, and generate OQL
mendix_11_features.impact: Accelerates development by 30-50% for common tasks through natural language interaction

mendix_11_features.description: React-based client is now the default for all new apps. Dojo client deprecated and will be removed in future versions.
mendix_11_features.impact: Better performance, modern development patterns, improved mobile support
mendix_11_features.migration_notes: Existing Dojo apps can continue but should plan migration. Use MigrateToReact module from Marketplace.

mendix_11_features.description: Workflows now support interrupting boundary events, recurrence patterns, and improved error handling
mendix_11_features.impact: More robust business process automation with complex scenarios

mendix_11_features.description: Define read-only entities based on OQL queries for complex data aggregation without performance impact
mendix_11_features.impact: Enables complex reporting without custom Java or stored procedures

mendix_11_features.description: Built-in distributed tracing with OpenTelemetry standard for monitoring microservice architectures
mendix_11_features.impact: Better observability in production systems, easier debugging of performance issues
mendix_11_features.integration: Works with Datadog, New Relic, Azure Monitor, AWS X-Ray

breaking_changes_mendix_11.description: MariaDB 10.5, Microsoft SQL Server 2019, and MySQL 8.0 are no longer supported
breaking_changes_mendix_11.impact: Must upgrade database versions before upgrading to 11.4+
breaking_changes_mendix_11.fix: Upgrade to: MariaDB 10.6+, SQL Server 2022+, MySQL 8.4+, or Oracle 23 (newly supported)

breaking_changes_mendix_11.description: Version schema now follows SemVer (major.minor.patch) - build number dropped
breaking_changes_mendix_11.impact: Scripts parsing version numbers may need updates
breaking_changes_mendix_11.fix: Update version parsing logic to handle 3-part versions

breaking_changes_mendix_11.description: Switched from IndexedDB to OPFS storage for offline apps. First load triggers data migration.
breaking_changes_mendix_11.impact: First app load after upgrade will be slower due to migration
breaking_changes_mendix_11.fix: Inform users about one-time migration delay

breaking_changes_mendix_11.description: ShowHomePage action now respects entity access rules. Previously bypassed security checks.
breaking_changes_mendix_11.impact: May break existing microflows if entities lack proper access rules
breaking_changes_mendix_11.fix: Review all ShowHomePage actions and ensure proper entity access rules configured

breaking_changes_mendix_11.description: XPath expressions with +, -, *, / now require matching types. Automatic type coercion removed.
breaking_changes_mendix_11.impact: XPath constraints with mixed integer/decimal operations will fail

breaking_changes_mendix_11.description: String concatenation using + operator deprecated. Use concat() function instead.
formatDateTime and parseDateTime now use ISO 8601 patterns by default
breaking_changes_mendix_11.impact: Custom date formats may render differently
breaking_changes_mendix_11.fix: Review all date formatting and update patterns to ISO 8601 standard

breaking_changes_mendix_11.description: Dojo-based client officially deprecated. React client is now default.
breaking_changes_mendix_11.impact: Custom widgets using Dojo APIs need migration
breaking_changes_mendix_11.fix: Plan migration to React widgets using MigrateToReact module

breaking_changes_mendix_11.description: Mendix 11 requires Java 21. Java 17 no longer supported.
breaking_changes_mendix_11.impact: Deployment environments must upgrade to Java 21
breaking_changes_mendix_11.fix: Update runtime environments to Java 21 before upgrading

breaking_changes_mendix_11.description: Many Marketplace modules require updates for Mendix 11 compatibility
breaking_changes_mendix_11.impact: Apps may fail to start if modules are incompatible
breaking_changes_mendix_11.fix: Check Marketplace for updated module versions before upgrading

entity_types.description: Standard database-backed entity stored in project database
entity_types.use_when: Need to store data permanently, support CRUD operations, define associations
entity_types.storage: Database table with columns per attribute
entity_types.performance: Fast for indexed queries, slower for large unindexed datasets

entity_types.description: Temporary entities stored only in memory during request lifecycle
entity_types.use_when: Form data, API request/response models, temporary calculations
entity_types.storage: Memory only - lost after commit or page navigation

entity_types.description: Entity defined in external system accessed via OData or REST
entity_types.use_when: Integration with external services (SAP, Salesforce, custom APIs)
entity_types.storage: External system - Mendix only caches metadata

entity_types.use_when: Complex reporting, data aggregation, joining multiple entities

entity_types.performance: Depends on OQL complexity and database indexes

associations.description: One parent entity relates to multiple child entities
associations.storage: Foreign key in child table pointing to parent
associations.delete_behavior: Delete parent can cascade delete children or prevent deletion
associations.best_practice: Most common pattern, use as default unless many-to-many needed
associations.ownership: Child owns the association (foreign key in child table)

associations.description: Multiple entities on both sides can relate to each other
associations.storage: Join table with two foreign keys (automatically created by Mendix)
associations.delete_behavior: Delete either side removes join table entries
associations.performance: Good but requires join table lookup
associations.best_practice: Use when entities truly have bidirectional many relationship
associations.ownership: Neither owns - Mendix creates System.Association table

associations.description: One entity relates to exactly one other entity
associations.storage: Foreign key in child table with unique constraint
associations.delete_behavior: Similar to one-to-many but enforces uniqueness
associations.performance: Excellent - single foreign key with unique index
associations.best_practice: Use when truly one-to-one. Consider embedding attributes if always loaded together

associations.delete_behavior: Must handle carefully to avoid orphans
associations.performance: Good but complex recursive queries can be slow
associations.best_practice: Limit depth, consider materialized path pattern for deep hierarchies

generalization.description: Entity inheritance - child entities inherit attributes and associations from parent
generalization.use_when: Entities share common attributes but have specialized behavior
generalization.storage: All attributes stored in parent table with Type discriminator column
generalization.performance: Good - single table, but larger rows
advantages: Polymorphic queries (retrieve all types via parent)
disadvantages: Cannot add associations from parent after children created
All child attributes in single table (larger row size)

example.use_case: Vehicle management system with different vehicle types

generalization.best_practice: Use for true IS-A relationships. Avoid deep hierarchies (max 2-3 levels). Consider composition if not true inheritance.

calculated_attributes.description: Virtual attributes computed from other attributes or associations
calculated_attributes.performance: Can be slow if accessed frequently or involves complex logic
calculated_attributes.use_when: Value derived from other attributes, infrequently accessed, no need to query
alternatives: Store as regular attribute and update via events (faster reads, more storage)
Compute in microflow when needed (explicit control)
Use view entity with OQL (for complex aggregations)

example.use_case: Display full name without storing redundantly

calculated_attributes.best_practice: Avoid in data grids or lists (N+1 problem). Use only for display in forms or single-object contexts.

types.fires: Immediately before object saved to database
types.use_case: Validation, computed attribute updates, audit logging

types.fires: Immediately after object saved to database
types.use_case: Notifications, external API calls, triggering workflows

Delete associated files from external storage

best_practices: Keep events fast - avoid complex logic or external calls in Before Commit
Use After Commit for notifications and external APIs
Be careful with infinite loops (event triggers another event)
Events don't fire for bulk operations (use microflows instead)

anti_patterns.why_bad: Slows down all saves, can cause timeouts, hard to handle failures
anti_patterns.alternative: Use After Commit or async microflow

anti_patterns.why_bad: Impacts performance of all CRUD operations

naming_conventions.purpose: Action microflows called from pages (buttons, on-click)
Sub-microflows (reusable logic called by other microflows)
Data source microflows for data grids and list views

bpmn_elements.description: Exit point returning value or void
bpmn_elements.best_practice: Multiple end events for different outcomes (success, error)

best_practices.rationale: Easier to maintain, test, and reuse. Follows single responsibility principle.
best_practices.example: Instead of one 500-line microflow, create multiple sub-microflows for different steps

best_practices.rationale: Avoid duplication, centralize business logic, easier to update
best_practices.example: SUB_Customer_Validate called by ACT_Customer_Save and API operations

best_practices.rationale: Each commit is expensive (database transaction + events). Batch when possible.
best_practices.example: In loops, commit after processing batch of 100 instead of every iteration

best_practices.rationale: Prevent unhandled exceptions, provide user feedback, log for debugging
best_practices.example: Add error handlers to all API calls and Java actions

best_practices.rationale: Keep transactions short, commit regularly in long operations

real_world_examples.solution: Order entity with associations to Customer, OrderLine (1-*), Product. Before Commit event calculates total. After Commit triggers notification workflow.

Document entity with FileDocument generalization. Workflow entity tracks approval steps. Event handlers update status.

performance_notes: Studio Pro 11 introduces improved caching and query optimization. React client has better performance than Dojo. View entities enable complex queries without custom Java. Always profile with built-in Performance Tool before optimizing.
security_notes: Mendix 11 enforces stricter security by default. ShowHomePage now respects entity access. Always define explicit access rules. Use XPath constraints for row-level security. Never bypass security unless absolutely necessary and well-documented.
testing_strategy: Use built-in unit testing (UnitTesting module from Marketplace). Test microflows with different roles. Use Application Test Suite (ATS) for UI testing. Test security rules with different user roles. Profile performance with Performance Tool.
